qas.question: In what year was the book published in which Hayek developed Hebbian learning?
Before he began studying economics, what concept did Hayek come up with that was later featured in his 1952 book?
What did Hayek present in his 1952 book that affected multiple areas of science?
What is the name of the book in which Hayek presented the Hebbian Synapse?

answers.text: The Sensory Order: An Inquiry into the Foundations of Theoretical Psychology

context: In <a3_0>The Sensory Order: An Inquiry into the Foundations of Theoretical Psychology<a3_0/> (<a0_0>1952<a0_0/>), Hayek independently developed a "<a1_0>Hebbian learning<a1_0/>" model of learning and memory – an idea which he first conceived in 1920, prior to his study of economics. Hayek's expansion of the <a2_0>"Hebbian synapse"<a2_0/> construction into a global brain theory has received continued attention in neuroscience, cognitive science, computer science, behavioural science, and evolutionary psychology, by scientists such as Gerald Edelman, and Joaquin Fuster.
